intro: Diaphoranthema biflora, commonly known as the double-flowered daisies, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant features two distinct types of flowers: central disc flowers and surrounding ray flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Diaphoranthema biflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant colors and compact growth habit.
